content.description: Slightly flaring right-leaning crack to bolted face.  Slabby climbing on knobs, slopers, and edges.  Pretty fun route if you're in the neighborhood.

climbs.name: Mr. Clean
climbs.fa: Victor Marcus, Malcolm Jolly, Jim Day, 1977

content.description: Awesome route (when it's clean). Bouldery start, to right-ward traverse, past a fixed pin, finish on stellar left-leaning hand crack.
content.location: Stranded in the middle of Black Wall, with a couple of other obscure but good routes.  Between "One Hand Clapping" area and "Black September" area.

content.description:
Walk past "Slipstream" to the "Full Tilt" ledges. This is the left chimney of the huge detached tooth that forms "Full Tilt". Climb up a short easy corner to the top of a flake. Stand on top of the flake and burrow into the secure chimney. There is a cool cave behind the tooth. Climb to the top of the tooth and back out on the face to a chain anchor. Belay here and toprope "Full Tilt" or continue up a thin crack with incipient pro to ledges and more climbs.

This climb has pitches below and above which are dirty and less traveled.
content.protection: A few cams. The squeeze section is secure but unprotectable.

content.description: Alternate finish to Mr. Clean.  About 2/3 of the way up, head straight up the thin splitter crack (rather than left up Mr. Clean).  Something tiny, like a black Alien, protects the crux.
content.location: In between the Firecracker area and the Black September area.
